div.pre: 7 Santorin (anc. Thera), 1821 (920) Burial: c. 500-490 B.C. (Holloway) Contents: 760 AR Aegina: 541 st. Andros orCeos: 1 st. The New York Sale 20 (2009) lot 175 Naxos: 15 st. (14 with cantharus, at least one wreathed; 1 with satyr hd.) Nomos 1 (2009) lot 88 Paros: 2 st. Siphnos: 3 st. Thera?: 23 st. Cyzicus: 2 st. (as Traité pl. 16,25) Dardanus?: 1 st. (cock obv.; possibly the Montagu piece, cf. no. 6 above, Cyclades 1889) Miletus?: 48 st. (as Traité pl. 19,11 [47] 14 [1])* Unc. Caria?: 41 st. (Kraay, Greek Coins, no. 687 for type and attrib.) Unc. mint : 1 st. (boar's hd.) 82 fr. (boar's hd.; Aeginetan tetrob. according to Babelon [Traité II.1, p. 625] but the stater weighs c. 14.50 gms.) Disposition: London some; Copenhagen † Wroth, NC 1884, pp. 269-80, illus. Greenwell, NC 1890, pp. 13-9 BMCIonia, pp. xxxii ff. Holloway, ANSMN 10 (1962), pp. 6-7 *Noe describes all 48 as inscribed ΟϒΛ but Wroth (p. 273) says that type does not seem to have been in the hd. See also no. 8 below
